intro: Cladoceras, commonly known as the water clover, is a genus of aquatic plants belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and small, floating leaves that resemble the shape of clover leaves. These plants are typically found in shallow, still or slow-moving freshwater environments. Cladoceras species are often used in water gardens and pond ecosystems due to their ornamental value and ability to improve water quality. They reproduce through both vegetative propagation and seed production, depending on the species.
